name: Barcelo Bavaro Palace Deluxe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very beautiful. Although, check in took a very long time. Once we finish with our check-in we were not directed to go to the concierge to booked our 6 days dinner. We had a friend that came before us and told us that we needed to make reservation for dinner. If our friend didn't tell us we would have not known to do that. For this hotel to be all-inclusive was not true, due to we had to pay to eat at the French Restaurant ($10 per person). The bar restaurant was always busy no matter what time of day we try to eat there. People was just there to watch sports so every time we would try to make it for lunch or dinner it was always busy so we didn't get to try out much at the bar restaurant.
reviews.title: summer vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was very nice and friendly especially the staff at the Taino Pool Bar , Omar Madrigal, Jan Valdez and Luz Rodriquez. You need to ask Omar to make the virgin strawberry daiquiri for the kids. It's awesome.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, lovely beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Other than that our family had a great time there.
reviews.title: Great holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful resort. Service is uneven and the staff is not friendly. For me that affects my vacation. We loved our room-a family suite. The kids need their own space(TV, Bathroom, Closets, and Ipod docks). Every resort should add these to their room selections, Food was uneven-the seafood restaurant was lousy. Our best meal was at the Japanese restaurant and the 19th Hole, The 19th Hole is the best kept secret on the resort. We also liked the Italian restaurant. What I hated is that you had to make reservations and none of the places was ever full. Getting the reservation was difficult too, Finally, my other complaint is that we never got wash cloths after the 2nd or 3rd day of our stay. Our room was cleaned on all but one day but a phone call to front desk rectified that problem but it was 7PM when we came back to discover this, There is nightly entertainment and daily activities near the pool. I got a massage and the hydrotherapy was awesome. A must do!
reviews.title: Nice all-inclusive but not spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice place!
reviews.title: Won't comeback!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to the Barcelo Bavaro Palace for our best friend's 30th wedding anniversary and the only word that comes to mind is AWESOME!!! I am a travel agent so I know travel and expectations. Of which some of you have wayyyy too many. Let me start by complimenting a few employees who went out of their way for us. Ms. Amarfi checked us in at Club premium and she not only greeted us with enthusiam, but with a beautiful persona as well. Her first words to us were "welcome home"...and that's just how we felt. We had champagne while checking in and so our initial touchdown was a sheer success. We booked the master suite and the panoramic suite and were deliciously entranced with the rooms, ammenities, and not to mention,the view!! I thought Aruba, St John, Jamaica, had great beaches, but this beach is my favorite by far. The rooms were very clean and modern with a minimalistic hint, and very comfortable.My housekeeper was the best. I didnt get her name because I was out when she was in, but we communicated by notes, very well! My husband left a bag on the bus and it seemed things were going to take a nose dive since he had no other clothes or his golf shoes and that was his main focus. However, Berali came to our rescue and diligently phoned CNT Tours until she located someone(after hours) who delivered his bag post haste! I can't tell you how Ms. Berali saved the DAY!!! She is a friend for life. I am bringing a group in January and will look for Berali and Amarfi upon arrival. Edison our bellman was very helpful and informative and even with my limited Spanish, we GOT IT! He explained our room, lighting, doors etc. It was great to know, because the doors must be closed to keep the AC flowing. Thanks Edison. Our food was good everywhere we ate and we are a bit particular but adventurous at the same time. We had great steaks, seafood, and chicken dishes and loved loved loved breakfast. (SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE) Our bartenders were great in the lobby bar Carey. Many thanks to Willie, Victor, Samuel, and Maria for making us feel like family. The spa....thanks to Wendy, girl you are the best. I hope all who come for spa treatments/hydrotherapy, whatever there, gets you! So friendly and genuine. We relaxed well, ate well, and yes drank well the entire week! It was like paradise. The adults side was AWEsome as well....loved the open air restaurant and soooo loved Chez Gourmet! So if you go to Barcelo Bavaro Palace looking for good people, you will find them, if you go looking for good food, you will find it, if you go looking for great rooms with great views and great beaches, you will find those too. If you go with an open mind to experience a different enviornment with a lot of Spanish culture and bring a little patience,your time at the Barcelo Bavaro Palace can mimmick the time we had there. Thanks to you all! Wish I was there now!!! KC Cabell Atlanta Georgia...
reviews.title: AWESOME!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visisted this location for our annual "getaway" trip. the island was beautiful! water, and sand were great!! rooms were AMAZING--the one negative, which was a big one, was it seems like with the entire staff there was a HUGE language barrier, this would be the only thing keeping us from visiting this resort/chain again. Since visiting here we have started to visit Riu properties around Caribbean and dont want to go to anything else. REALLY humid
reviews.title: Beautiful!! but big language barrier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good here, and the property is huge--nice little train that takes you around the property.
reviews.title: Very disappointing for DR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the resort for 7 days. Visually, the resort is beautiful and impressive. The resort is very clean and well maintained. Unfortunately that is where it stops. The Staff is incredibly rude, I mean really rude No one speaks more than a few words in English, I mean no one. I read that from another review and I was like no big deal. But it is actually a big deal. Front desk is slow and useless. We checked in, verified we had a king room. Went to the room and it was 2 double beds. It took literally 42 minutes for the front desk to answer the phone. No one spoke English so we had bellman try to explain in Spanish. They said no King till tomorrow. We called the next day and were told to come to the front desk. When we got there we tried to explain. She left us at the front desk for over an hour until we saw her laughing with someone else. We got her attention and then she said to come back or call in an hour. When we called, again no one answered for close to an hour. They eventually sent a bellman, we went to the room and again 2 double beds and no king. We went back to the original room out of frustration. We called the front desk, started explaining and the rep hung up on us.
reviews.title: Breathtaking beach and pool area.. thats about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: So now lest talk about the all inclusive experience. The food is 100% awful. I got sick on the second day, my wife got sick the 3rd day. I have had Dominican and island food before (not to mention I was born in the Caribbean) and I have never had such bad food. We tried all the buffets and they all serve the same bad food, their so called 2 buffets Miramar and Bohio Dominicano is the same crap food that they serve the only difference is the different seating furniture. The restaurants that they have all look nice and their food is better than the buffets but they are still bad. The food is incredibly oily and tasteless and no authenticity. Now included is unlimited liquor right?? Well the liquor in all of the bars are cheap imitations of the real stuff. They taste absolutely awful. None of the drinks were good, even straight drinks tasted like crap. And you can forget about the minibars in the room. All you will find in there is presidente beer. It will take 12 cans of it just to feel like you are drinking beer. The juice and the soda in the minibar is almost never refilled by housekeeping. They also taste funny, once I checked the bottles I noticed why. All of the sodas and juices were set to expire in a few days.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel back in 99 and had not returned again until the week of July 29 to August 5, 2012. We were pleasantly surprised with the buildings and improvements to Barcelo done recently. All very clean! Before, the Barcelo Bavaro Beach was the Palace, has been completely renovated to new pools of a very pretty blue ceramic tiles, jacuzzi with water jets, this area is for adults only! The rooms are very spacious with ceramic floor, our clothes didn't get any moisture odor as in other hotels we have been, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. We had a room close to everything and in the lower floor, as we requested, due to problems in my knees, though the building has elevators, we do not remember to have seen elevators in 99, possibly they were added when the remodeling was done.
reviews.title: Barcelo Palace Deluxe and Barcelo Bavaro Beach!!!! We love you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food is good, a wide variety and plenty of places to eat, drinks also very good.
reviews.title: Girls 50th birthday trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach as beautiful as I remembered from my previous visit, we made no tours outside the resort, the area of ​​Bavaro Palace Deluxe is fantastic, they have a pirate ship with water jets and other kids pools with lots of fun for the little ones. at the Barcelo Beach which is for adults only, one is entitled to use the restaurants (only 2 are not included), bars, shows, disco, casino, pools of the Barcelo Palace Deluxe, the shows are of high quality and a huge theater suitable to accommodate many people comfortably, the Deluxe has a shopping mall at the entrance, the restaurants a la carte are very luxurious and with a great menu of food, the casino has a very good size, the Disco is very nice, spacious, good music . The complex is made in a way that corridors connects with all the buildings and you don't have to worry if it is raining.For transportation, trains are constantly passing around the complex and there is always room for everyone who wants to use them. The employees are wonderful, all of them treat you with respect and desire to serve and please you, they are not expecting a tip, we tip them because they deserve it. I will mention here some of the names of the employees that I remember ,but really, all Barcelo employees behaved wonderfully with us! Danilsa Acevedo and Andrea Peralta in reservations, thanks for considering my request for a room near everything , Evelyn Ramirez in customer service who behaved wonderfully with us, Iris, Librado (can be Liberto, not sure), Miguelina who looked after us so well at the restaurants, Ramon Sosa security was so kind. We are already planning to return next summer and now with the whole family! Thank you very much and continue with such a good service. Barcelo Bavaro Beach and Barcelo Palace Deluxe are the best!!!!!!! Thank you for pampering us! We'll be back! Esther
reviews.title: We Had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is absolutely beautiful! it is unfortunate that the staf know very limited english. Our check in was a three hour nightmare, The check in staff did not seem to care about any of our needs. With the negative out of the way I will focus on the positive. The restaurants had good food and the server's were friendly. The beach was beautiful and so was the pool area, We enjoyed the swim up bar and the delicious rum drinks. The only restaurant reservations we could get were for late night however we just went to each restaurant two hours early and were seated right away. I would definately go, but the next time I will know some basic spanish.
reviews.title: Great and could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff was well trained and friendly , specialy Chanil , even when we had a bit of a problem finding our reservation , but was resolved , I just wish we never go to a "Fieston " trip , but overall we enjoy the resort ,.
reviews.title: We're Going to Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: About ten years ago I visited this hotel and it had always been my favorite. Now, although gorgeously remodeled, I do not plan on ever returning. Don't pay the extra for "ocean-view" because in order to appreciate it you have to stick out your head from the balcony. Since I went to the hotel with plans to rest I had no energy to go back or call reception. Food and service are 3 star. Usually, it doesn't matter much to me because I'm only interested in the beach. But, due to the weather, the beach was not clean & clear. You wonder why you cannot try out just one restaurant during a short stay. When you call to reserve they only have 11PM availability. You walk by the restaurant and they have numerous empty tables. I'm sorry, but it is not worth it. Better to pay half what this one cost and be content with "you get what you pay for". My parents were born & raised in Dom Rep so I don't feel I am excessively picky. I just cannot recommend it.
reviews.title: Not returning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'm currently here, and couldn't wait to write this review, just in case there's someone out there planning to come, maybe he or she could have a change of heart after reading my review and didn't waste money coming here ( as I did) ... Been here for 2 days and leaving tomorrow ... We arrived to encounter a HELL of a check in process, lacking any kind of logistic and order. Everyone was complaining, no special lines for family with children or elderly couples. SHAME ON YOU!! I thought some old folks would faint in the process.
reviews.title: Lower your expectations or choose another Hotel in the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager ( Carlos Manso) kept telling people to please stay calm ( how can someone stay calm in this hot weather and with a checking process that lasts almost an hour?? ) Pick any employee you want ( jairo, dovic, Carlos) and they all need some serious Customer Care training ... The bellboys were nice, tried to do their job, but people leave the registry process so frustrated its hard to perceive any good service.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL REGULAR SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food... Restaurant Bohio Dominicano : Lower your expectations, Breakfast always the same, and lunch, had to pick burguers to survive . If you come with toddlers, bring them their food, or surrender to spend the weekend eating bread, fruit and bananas. Food looked and tasted old, Pizzas, should not be called pizzas here. If you don't want to eat in the buffet, reserve in one of the special restaurants a MONTH AHEAD. Employees look bored, are not pretty nice , like the girl in the bohio Restaurant, that practically barked after asking here for an orange juice ( " Only water, soda or wine" ) , sit on a table and wait at least 15 minutes for staff to arrange it ( had to get forks, and napkins myself) . For toddlers they have special eating chairs ( you have to ask for them and also wait at least 15 mins, recommend to get them yourself, employees will be eager to point you were they are at so you get the chair yourself.
reviews.title: Was a beautiful property!!! Rooms are nice and modern!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms : Very clean, nice AC, Cleaning Staff ok, but talk to loud on the hall ( hello????? people are trying to rest!!!) Be aware of the water temperature in the Bathroom, it's crazy, hot does not necessarily means hot ...Asked for a crib for my baby, got one, broken and loose.
reviews.title: Big and basic, except the breathtaking beach

description: Barceló Bávaro Palace Deluxe*****, a unique and unrepeatable locationon the best beach of Punta Cana, protected by a coral reef that converts the sea into a natural swimming pool.This an all-inclusive luxury gastronomic hotel is a new concept in luxury on the best beach in Punta Cana.All the rooms have terrace and sea views (front or partial) and jacuzzi for two persons with hydrotherapy, Well-being of the latest generation.
